instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging problem
threads.message: when i get this macbook it want  start there was short on <CAPACITOR>C7430</CAPACITOR> and broken r 7006 , i change them and it start working but when i connect charger  lcd backlight stop working when i disconect it lcd back to normal , i change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and u 7701 , reset smc and still the same...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging problem
threads.message:
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.
Try known good LIO board/flex.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level.

Just in case, do 2-3 times PRAM reset.
